Vocabularies.Definition: n., a. opposite 反面（的）；相反（的）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Cruelty is the contrary of kindness.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.	 serving to keep in mind 纪念（性）的 n.  sth. done or made to remind people of an event, person, etc. 纪念物；纪念碑；纪念仪式
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A memorial service is being held for her in St Paul's Church.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. (dwelt or dwelled) reside	居住
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  American Indians used to dwell in the forests.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. full of, covered in, mystery 神秘的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They're being very mysterious about their holiday plans.

Vocabularies.Definition: continue to live or exist 继续生活；继续存在
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She lived on for many years after her husband died.

Vocabularies.Definition: soon after …后不久
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They moved to Europe shortly after that.

Vocabularies.Definition: cause 导致
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His mistakes led to his failure.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. show approval of by clapping the hands; praise, approve 鼓掌赞许；称赞
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The residents in the neighborhood all applauded the council's decision to close the small dye factory.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.   make or become unclear（使）变模糊
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His eyes were blurred with tears.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. sth. that has real existence; a thing's existence 实际存在物；实体
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. Persons and corporations are equivalent entities under the law.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. supposedly 可能，大概，据推测
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Presumably the bad weather has delayed the flight.

Vocabularies.Definition: what about  …怎么样
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Now we've talked about work on tulips, what of other commercially important flowers, like roses?

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  cause to appear small by contrast or distance 使显得渺小，使相形见绌
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His children were dwarfed by insufficient food.

Vocabularies.Definition: away from one's country or home, esp. as a punishment 于流放中
v. have as a cause or beginning; be the creator of 起源于，来自
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The use of steam originated many other reforms.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. get; trace (sth. from a source) 获得；追溯…的起源
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Many English words are derived from Latin.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. class or group of things  in a complete system of grouping 种类；范畴
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There are different categories of books in the library.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   state of being miserable; great suffering 悲惨的境遇；苦难，不幸
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  lead a life of misery

Vocabularies.Definition: n. system of moral principles, rules of conduct 道德标准，行为准则
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Such an action is a violation of medical ethics.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  an element of a specified kind in sb.'s character 个性特征
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There is a streak of cruelty in his character.
